image.altText: A generic stock photo graphic of school students.

props.synopsis: Students throughout the world have fallen behind on reading and maths during the pandemic, but Australian teens have managed to buck the trend.

title.children: The results are in: How Australia's education rankings map a class divide

image.altText: Two First Nations toddlers, one holding a teddy bear

props.synopsis: The Federal Court in Brisbane has been told the Queensland government has racially discriminated against Indigenous children by denying them connection with family and culture.

title.children: Queensland government accused of 'modern stolen generation' in class actions alleging discrimination

image.altText: Michelle Bullock speaks at a podium with branding behind her. She is gesturing with her hand.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has left millions of borrowers a little more relaxed for their summer holidays, keeping interest rates on hold.

title.children: RBA gives Australians a break after biggest decline in spending power in 40 years

image.altText: Jack Green looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners have set up a new negotiating body to try to speed up sacred site and compensation talks with mining giant Glencore over the toxic McArthur River Mine in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Traditional owners of toxic McArthur River Mine seek to speed up sacred site protection talks

image.altText: Tropical Cyclone Jasper is near the Solomons and tracking south

props.synopsis: Jasper is the first cyclone of the season, but it's not yet clear how close it will come to the Queensland coast.

title.children: Cyclone Jasper forms off Queensland coast, marking an unusually early start to season

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

props.synopsis: The exclusivity agreement and an invoice have been released by the Federal Court as part of Mr Lehrmann's defamation trial against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Seven Network paying Bruce Lehrmann's rent at cost of $4,000 per fortnight, court documents reveal

image.altText: Penny Wong talking during Question Time.

props.synopsis: Preventative detention laws have been passed by the Senate as the federal government continues to mop up from the High Court ruling that indefinite immigration detention was illegal.

title.children: Preventative detention laws rushed through parliament targeting most serious criminals released from detention

image.altText: Men look at a drone.

props.synopsis: A Ukrainian drone manufacturer has told ABC's 7.30 he believes Russian drones are now outnumbering Ukrainian ones on the frontlines by five to one.

title.children: Ukraine's drones have revolutionised warfare but Russia is catching up

image.altText: An aerial photo of a series of ships lashed side to side in a line.

props.synopsis: The Philippine Coast Guard revealed it was monitoring more than 135 Chinese ships "swarming" at a disputed South China Sea reef within the country's exclusive economic zone.

title.children: Why scores of Chinese boats were 'swarming' at a reef within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone

image.altText: John Pesutto and Moira Deeming in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Victorian MP Moira Deeming lodges a defamation lawsuit against her former boss and state Liberal leader John Pesutto in the Federal Court.

title.children: Victorian MP Moira Deeming lodges defamation suit against former boss John Pesutto

image.altText: A composite of a woman with long blonde hair, and blue sign featuring the adidas logo affixed to a building exterior

props.synopsis: Sarah Luke says she feels "relief mixed with joy" over the finding, and hopes it will set a precedent for another claim the National Basketball Association has brought against her.

title.children: US court dismisses Adidas's $1.5m claim against Byron Bay data breach victim, but NBA case looms

image.altText: Judge Gregory Geason looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's parliament is being recalled to consider whether an inquiry should be held to decide the future of a Supreme Court judge who is facing criminal charges.

title.children: Snap parliament recall to consider future of Tasmanian Supreme Court judge facing criminal charges

image.altText: The outside of the Melbourne Magistrates' Court, an off-white building with two stories.

props.synopsis: A recently released immigration detainee is remanded in custody in Melbourne after being charged with failing to comply with sex offender reporting obligations.

title.children: Sex offender released from immigration detention charged after Melbourne arrest

image.altText: Dilapidated hospital hallway with no equipment or facilities

props.synopsis: The Pacific Games has been heralded as a "resounding triumph" for the Pacific region, but with ill Solomon Islanders treated in hospital car parks, some are asking, at what cost?

title.children: 'Repulsive work conditions': Solomon Islands doctors furious over Pacific Games spending

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek and  Senator Sarah Hanson-Young arrive to speak during a presser.

props.synopsis: New laws that would allow farmers and other land managers to cash in on nature-boosting practices passes parliament after Tanya Plibersek struck a deal with the Greens, her second in less than 10 days.

title.children: 'Green Wall Street' passes parliament despite claims Labor is rushing legislation

image.altText: A picture of a gloved hand holding a stack of 50-dollar notes.

props.synopsis: Thousands of dollars are left "flying everywhere" on the Mitchell Freeway in Perth's north, with more cash and cocaine found in a nearby car, as the police commissioner praises motorists for reporting the incident.

title.children: Man charged as up to $40,000 found strewn across Perth freeway as if 'the cash cow had come out'

image.altText: A black and white image of a man squatting down in a field.

props.synopsis: Anthony Kenyon has pleaded guilty to pushing the 12-year-old off her bike, dragging her through a park and strangling her as she was riding home from school in 2022.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for knocking girl off bike and strangling her unconscious

image.altText: Inside a tunnel

props.synopsis: The hotly anticipated but unfinished document was mistakenly posted on the Department of Planning website on Tuesday, but deleted shortly after. It also appears to reveal the fate of the Metro West project.

title.children: Sydney suburbs targeted for high-density housing revealed in accidently published list

image.altText: A woman and man both leaving court separately with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A man on trial for allegedly having sex with underage female employees at his regional South Australian bakery tells the District Court that any sexual contact he had with the teenagers happened after the legal age of consent.

title.children: Bakery owner accused of having sex with underage employees upset about 'baby farm' claims, court hears

image.altText: Discarded beer cans lying on a football oval.

props.synopsis: In a letter sent to the director of Liquor Licensing, Deputy Police Commissioner Allan Adams says "immediate intervention" is needed to address shocking rates of domestic violence and other forms of crime.

title.children: 'Strong and immediate intervention': Widespread alcohol restrictions proposed for WA

image.altText: Illustration of woman and man sitting on a car bonnet

props.synopsis: While waiting ten years for the next instalment, Grand Theft Auto gamers went digging for clues. Now we are getting our first look at what's in store for GTAVI.

title.children: Grand Theft Auto VI has been 10 years in the making. The first trailer has finally arrived

image.altText: A coal-fired power plant

props.synopsis: New research shows global carbon emissions from fossil fuels have increased over the past year despite most of the world committing to net zero targets.

title.children: Global emissions at record highs as world continues to overspend on 'carbon budget'

image.altText: Cate Campbell hugs Bronte Campbell. They each have a medal around their neck.

props.synopsis: With no host in place for the 2026 Commonwealth Games and an increasingly bleak outlook of finding one after the Gold Coast withdrew its speculative bid to save it, we may have seen the last of the old Empire Games. But could it be kept alive for the athletes of tomorrow?

title.children: The Commonwealth Games is on its last legs — but could it be saved with a left-field idea?

image.altText: View from the air as the rescue chopper approaches Mount Tibrogargan for a rescue.

props.synopsis: A rock climber has been airlifted to hospital with head, shoulder and leg injuries from the accident in Queensland's Glass House Mountains.

title.children: Rescuers winch seriously injured man to helicopter after 20m fall from mountain

image.altText: A man in a suit on a laptop searching real estate websites.

props.synopsis: More people looking to break into the property market are lying on their loan applications in a desperate bid to try to secure a home loan, according to new data. The struggle to refinance is also getting harder with more interest rate rises in 2024 possible.

title.children: 'People can be very creative': Inside the rise of 'liar loans' in Australia's property market

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe wears suit and tie walks on Sydney street

props.synopsis: The former television host was given a good behaviour bond after he returned a positive drug test earlier this year from a police stop.

title.children: 'I've got to keep doing well': Andrew O'Keefe avoids conviction after pleading guilty to drug-driving

image.altText: A tattooed man singing on stage

props.synopsis: A teary Mitchell Callaway, who has been in custody for six months, jumped with excitement when a Supreme Court judge granted his release on bail.

title.children: Bail granted for former X Factor contestant Mitchell Callaway, charged with 2018 murder of a baby

image.altText: Traffic on the road heading towards Balmain in sydney

props.synopsis: Sydney drivers are promised road works set to start tonight will bring some relief at the problem-plagued "spaghetti junction", but some experts say the project is fundamentally flawed.

title.children: 'Clear it would be a disaster': Sydney's Rozelle Interchange issues will be ongoing, road experts say

image.altText: A person's hand holding a mobile phone, showing the Spotify logo.

props.synopsis: It's the world's biggest music streaming service, but the Swedish-based company has just made its third and biggest job cuts of 2023.

title.children: Spotify cuts more than 1,500 jobs amid rising costs in third round of lay-offs

image.altText: A young man in a white shirt clapping

props.synopsis: "Swiftie" and "prompt" are among the words to have missed out on the Oxford Dictionary's top gong, which has gone to "Rizz" — a shortening of the word charisma.

title.children: 'Rizz' named Oxford Dictionary's word of the year

image.altText: A satellite imagery of the world's largest iceberg, named A23a, seen in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: Days after scientists declared the enormous iceberg was on the move, a research team documents their "incredibly lucky" encounter with the almost 4,000-square-kilometre berg as it drifts out of Antarctica.

title.children: New footage captures world's largest iceberg on the move, escaping Antarctica after decades grounded
